1.name: Bungeecord
1.description: For a long time, Minecraft server owners have had a dream that encompasses a free, easy, and reliable way to connect multiple Minecraft servers together. BungeeCord is the answer to said dream. Whether you are a small server wishing to string multiple game-modes together, or the owner of the ShotBow Network, BungeeCord is the ideal solution for you. With the help of BungeeCord, you will be able to unlock your community's full potential.

variables.name: Bungeecord Version
variables.description: The version of Bungeecord to download and use.

variables.name: Bungeecord Jar File
variables.description: The name of the Jarfile to use when running Bungeecord.

2.name: Paper
2.description: High performance Spigot fork that aims to fix gameplay and mechanics inconsistencies.

variables.name: Minecraft Version
variables.description:
The version of minecraft to download. 

Leave at latest to always get the latest version. Invalid versions will default to latest.

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: The name of the server jarfile to run the server with.

variables.name: Download Path
variables.description: A URL to use to download a server.jar rather than the ones in the install script. This is not user viewable.

variables.name: Build Number
variables.description:
The build number for the paper release.

Leave at latest to always get the latest version. Invalid versions will default to latest.

3.name: Forge Minecraft
3.description: Minecraft Forge Server. Minecraft Forge is a modding API (Application Programming Interface), which makes it easier to create mods, and also make sure mods are compatible with each other.

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: The name of the Jarfile to use when running Forge version below 1.17.

variables.name: Minecraft Version
variables.description:
The version of minecraft you want to install for.

Leaving latest will install the latest recommended version.

variables.name: Build Type
variables.description:
The type of server jar to download from forge.

Valid types are "recommended" and "latest".

variables.name: Forge Version
variables.description:
The full exact version.

Ex. 1.15.2-31.2.4

Overrides MC_VERSION and BUILD_TYPE. If it fails to download the server files it will fail to install.

4.name: Sponge (SpongeVanilla)
4.description: SpongeVanilla is the SpongeAPI implementation for Vanilla Minecraft.

variables.name: Sponge Version
variables.description: The version of SpongeVanilla to download and use.

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: The name of the Jarfile to use when running SpongeVanilla.

5.name: Vanilla Minecraft
5.description: Minecraft is a game about placing blocks and going on adventures. Explore randomly generated worlds and build amazing things from the simplest of homes to the grandest of castles. Play in Creative Mode with unlimited resources or mine deep in Survival Mode, crafting weapons and armor to fend off dangerous mobs. Do all this alone or with friends.

variables.name: Server Jar File
variables.description: The name of the server jarfile to run the server with.

variables.name: Server Version
variables.description: The version of Minecraft Vanilla to install. Use "latest" to install the latest version, or use "snapshot" to install the latest snapshot. Go to Settings > Reinstall Server to apply.

6.name: Custom Source Engine Game
6.description: This option allows modifying the startup arguments and other details to run a custom SRCDS based game on the panel.

variables.name: Game ID
variables.description: The ID corresponding to the game to download and run using SRCDS.

variables.name: Game Name
variables.description: The name corresponding to the game to download and run using SRCDS.

variables.name: Map
variables.description: The default map for the server.

7.name: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive
7.description: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is a multiplayer first-person shooter video game developed by Hidden Path Entertainment and Valve Corporation.

variables.name: Map
variables.description: The default map for the server.

variables.name: Steam Account Token
variables.description: The Steam Account Token required for the server to be displayed publicly.

variables.name: Source AppID
variables.description: Required for game to update on server restart. Do not modify this.

8.name: Insurgency
8.description: Take to the streets for intense close quarters combat, where a team's survival depends upon securing crucial strongholds and destroying enemy supply in this multiplayer and cooperative Source Engine based experience.

variables.name: Game ID
variables.description: The ID corresponding to the game to download and run using SRCDS.

variables.name: Default Map
variables.description: The default map to use when starting the server.

9.name: Ark: Survival Evolved
9.description: As a man or woman stranded, naked, freezing, and starving on the unforgiving shores of a mysterious island called ARK, use your skill and cunning to kill or tame and ride the plethora of leviathan dinosaurs and other primeval creatures roaming the land. Hunt, harvest resources, craft items, grow crops, research technologies, and build shelters to withstand the elements and store valuables, all while teaming up with (or preying upon) hundreds of other players to survive, dominate... and escape! — Gamepedia: ARK
9.startup: rmv() { echo -e "stopping server"; rcon -t rcon -a 127.0.0.1:${RCON_PORT} -p ${ARK_ADMIN_PASSWORD} -c saveworld && rcon -a 127.0.0.1:${RCON_PORT} -p ${ARK_ADMIN_PASSWORD} -c DoExit; }; trap rmv 15; cd ShooterGame/Binaries/Linux && ./ShooterGameServer {{SERVER_MAP}}?listen?SessionName="{{SESSION_NAME}}"?ServerPassword={{ARK_PASSWORD}}?ServerAdminPassword={{ARK_ADMIN_PASSWORD}}?Port={{SERVER_PORT}}?RCONPort={{RCON_PORT}}?QueryPort={{QUERY_PORT}}?RCONEnabled=True$( [ "$BATTLE_EYE" == "1" ] || printf %s ' -NoBattlEye' ) -server {{ARGS}} -log & until echo "waiting for rcon connection..."; rcon -t rcon -a 127.0.0.1:${RCON_PORT} -p ${ARK_ADMIN_PASSWORD}; do sleep 5; done

variables.name: Server Password
variables.description: If specified, players must provide this password to join the server.

variables.name: Admin Password
variables.description: If specified, players must provide this password (via the in-game console) to gain access to administrator commands on the server.

variables.name: Server Map
variables.description: Available Maps: TheIsland, TheCenter, Ragnarok, ScorchedEarth_P, Aberration_P, Extinction, Valguero_P, Genesis, CrystalIsles, Gen2, LostIsland, Fjordur

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: ARK server name

variables.name: Rcon Port
variables.description: ARK rcon port used by rcon tools.

variables.name: Query Port
variables.description: ARK query port used by steam server browser and ark client server browser.

variables.name: Auto-update server
variables.description:
This is to enable auto-updating for servers.

Default is 0. Set to 1 to update

variables.name: Battle Eye
variables.description:
Enable BattleEye

0 to disable
1 to enable

default="1"

variables.name: App ID
variables.description: ARK steam app id for auto updates. Leave blank to avoid auto update.

variables.name: Additional Arguments
variables.description: Specify additional launch parameters such as -crossplay. You must include a dash - and separate each parameter with space: -crossplay -exclusivejoin

10.name: Garrys Mod
10.description: Garrys Mod, is a sandbox physics game created by Garry Newman, and developed by his company, Facepunch Studios.

variables.name: Map
variables.description: The default map for the server.

variables.name: Steam Account Token
variables.description: The Steam Account Token required for the server to be displayed publicly.

variables.name: Source AppID
variables.description: Required for game to update on server restart. Do not modify this.

variables.name: Workshop ID
variables.description: The ID of your workshop collection (the numbers at the end of the URL)

variables.name: Gamemode
variables.description: The gamemode of your server.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: The maximum amount of players allowed on your game server.

variables.name: Tickrate
variables.description: The tickrate defines how fast the server will update each entity's location.

variables.name: Lua Refresh
variables.description:
0 = disable Lua refresh,
1 = enable Lua refresh

11.name: Team Fortress 2
11.description: Team Fortress 2 is a team-based first-person shooter multiplayer video game developed and published by Valve Corporation. It is the sequel to the 1996 mod Team Fortress for Quake and its 1999 remake.

variables.name: Game ID
variables.description: The ID corresponding to the game to download and run using SRCDS.

variables.name: Default Map
variables.description: The default map to use when starting the server.

variables.name: Steam
variables.description: The Steam Game Server Login Token to display servers publicly. Generate one at https://steamcommunity.com/dev/managegameservers

12.name: Teamspeak3 Server
12.description: VoIP software designed with security in mind, featuring crystal clear voice quality, endless customization options, and scalabilty up to thousands of simultaneous users.
12.startup: ./ts3server default_voice_port={{SERVER_PORT}} query_port={{QUERY_PORT}} filetransfer_ip=0.0.0.0 filetransfer_port={{FILE_TRANSFER}} query_http_port={{QUERY_HTTP}} query_ssh_port={{QUERY_SSH}} query_protocols={{QUERY_PROTOCOLS_VAR}} license_accepted=1

variables.name: Server Version
variables.description: The version of Teamspeak 3 to use when running the server.

variables.name: File Transfer Port
variables.description: The Teamspeak file transfer port

variables.name: Query Port
variables.description: The Teamspeak Query Port

variables.name: Query Protocols
variables.description:
Comma separated list of protocols that can be used to connect to the ServerQuery | 
Possible values are raw, ssh and http | 
E.g.: raw,ssh,http

variables.name: Query SSH Port
variables.description: TCP Port opened for ServerQuery connections using SSH

variables.name: Query HTTP Port
variables.description: TCP Port opened for ServerQuery connections using http

13.name: Mumble Server
13.description: Mumble is an open source, low-latency, high quality voice chat software primarily intended for use while gaming.

variables.name: Maximum Users
variables.description: Maximum concurrent users on the mumble server.

14.name: Rust
14.description: The only aim in Rust is to survive. To do this you will need to overcome struggles such as hunger, thirst and cold. Build a fire. Build a shelter. Kill animals for meat. Protect yourself from other players, and kill them for meat. Create alliances with other players and form a town. Do whatever it takes to survive.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: The name of your server in the public server list.

variables.name: Modding Framework
variables.description:
The modding framework to be used: carbon, oxide, vanilla.
Defaults to "vanilla" for a non-modded server installation.

variables.name: Level
variables.description: The world file for Rust to use.

variables.name: Description
variables.description: The description under your server title. Commonly used for rules & info. Use \n for newlines.

variables.name: URL
variables.description: The URL for your server. This is what comes up when clicking the "Visit Website" button.

variables.name: World Size
variables.description: The world size for a procedural map.

variables.name: World Seed
variables.description: The seed for a procedural map.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: The maximum amount of players allowed in the server at once.

variables.name: Server Image
variables.description: The header image for the top of your server listing.

variables.name: Query Port
variables.description: Server Query Port. Can't be the same as Game's primary port.

variables.name: RCON Port
variables.description: Port for RCON connections.

variables.name: RCON Password
variables.description: RCON access password.

variables.name: Save Interval
variables.description: Sets the server’s auto-save interval in seconds.

variables.name: Additional Arguments
variables.description: Add additional startup parameters to the server.

variables.name: App Port
variables.description: Port for the Rust+ App. -1 to disable.

variables.name: Server Logo
variables.description: The circular server logo for the Rust+ app.

variables.name: Custom Map URL
variables.description: Overwrites the map with the one from the direct download URL. Invalid URLs will cause the server to crash.

15.name: Python-Universal
15.description: Python egg with compatibility for multiple Python versions.

variables.name: Startup Command 1
variables.description: First Startup Command

variables.name: Startup Command 2 (Optional)
variables.description: Second Startup Command
